⁰ L. Minucius Basilus held high office in Gaul under Caesar, whom he afterwards helped to assassinate. It is conjectured that Cicero wrote this note on the Ides of fMarch inl reply to a report of the assassination received rom Basi us.

ὃ Aulus Pompeius Bithynicus, though himself a relative of Pompey's, fought during the civil war on Caesar's side. It seems that he was at this time propraetor in Sicily. He was afterwards put to death by Sextus Pompeius on a charge of plotting against him.
